mlotst.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mlotst.long_name: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
mlotst.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
mlotst.augmented_comment: The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by temperature, sigma or sigma_theta is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Thickness means the vertical extent of a layer.

mlotstmax.long_name: Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
mlotstmax.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
mlotstmax.augmented_comment: Maximum ocean mixed layer thickness. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by temperature, sigma or sigma_theta is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Thickness means the vertical extent of a layer.

mlotstmin.long_name: Minimum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
mlotstmin.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
mlotstmin.augmented_comment: Minimum ocean mixed layer thickness. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by temperature, sigma or sigma_theta is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. mlotstsq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mlotstsq.long_name: Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
mlotstsq.comment: The phrase 'square_of_X' means X*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by 'temperature', 'sigma', 'sigma_theta', 'sigma_t' or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. 'Thickness' means the vertical extent of a layer.

tos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tos.comment: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.
tos.augmented_comment: Temperature of sea water near the surface.

tosga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tosga.comment: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.
tosga.augmented_comment: global average sea surface temperature near the surface
